intro: Grazielia brevipetiolata, commonly known as the short-petioled grazielia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, palmate leaves with short petioles and clusters of yellowish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical regions. Grazielia brevipetiolata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
